key_responsibilities: greeting visitors
answering phones
scheduling and leading tours
responding to constituent requests for general information and other inquiries
maintaining the front office
assisting with various administrative duties
requirements: maintain a good relationship with the Member, staff, and constituents
willing to accept performance based criticism and direction while working well under pressure
open to having a flexible schedule

key_responsibilities: managing the Congressman’s D.C. schedule
tracking and responding to invitations
maintaining accurate lists of annual meetings and long-term planning
management of the intern program and junior staff
vouchering, reimbursements and budget tracking
management of office equipment and purchasing
requirements: None

key_responsibilities: Prepare comparative prints for the Office and the House using specialized software to show changes that bills make to laws and amendments make to bills, and changes between versions of the same document
Manage and update a database of Public Laws and compilations of Federal laws
Research provisions of Federal law and its amendatory history to compile the amendments made to the Federal law into the up-to-date form of the Federal law
Advise attorneys in the Office on technical amendatory issues arising in legislative drafts
Work cooperatively with teams both inside and outside of the Office in the development, improvement, and testing of specialized software used by the Office to carry out the duties of this position
Perform additional tasks as needed
requirements: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge of, and experience with, various information and office systems, including word processing, email, spreadsheet, and database
Ability to work both independently and in teams
Ability to work with short deadlines and handle multiple, ongoing projects while providing high quality results
Ability to focus on the task at hand
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including command of English grammar, spelling, and punctuation
Able technically to participate in software development and improvement
Willingness to learn and ask questions
Willingness periodically to work longer than a normal workday and on weekends
Experience working with XML is a plus
Experience using legislative research tools, including Congress.gov and UScode.house.gov, is a plus
Knowledge of copy editing is a plus

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: Texas contacts a plus
Excellent technical, written, and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: answering casework correspondence and verbal communications with constituents
managing and navigating constituents’ casework through federal agencies
attending and participating in community meetings and events, including some evenings and weekends
assessing casework and community activities for matters warranting legislative action
requirements: familiarity with federal agencies
excellent written and oral communication skills
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment
teamoriented
strong knowledge or connection to Mecklenburg County is a plus

key_responsibilities: oversee various issues including health care, education, oversight, and social issues
advises the Congressman on all legislative areas
assists in the development of policy, communications and legislative initiatives
requirements: Excellent writing and communication skills
Thorough knowledge of legislative process and of House organization and procedures
Ability to perform essential job functions above
Ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
Provides necessary organization, leadership and motivation to excel in given tasks
Excellent oral and written communications skills

key_responsibilities: act as the Member's primary liaison to all government, community and constituent groups and civic leaders
monitor developments, opinions and concerns in the district and update the Member accordingly
attend civic meetings, community gatherings, and other events, representing the Member when needed
direct the work of district outreach, case managers and other district staff in support of the office’s outreach plan
other administrative and management duties assigned
requirements: excellent oral and written communications skills
demonstrate initiative, including a proven capability to generate new ideas
ability to multi-task effectively in a fast-paced environment
several years of experience in government and/or community outreach, media relations
solid ties to the district and South Florida
strong knowledge of local issues, geography and demographics

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: minimum of three years of Hill experience
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Advanced degree a plus

office: Majority staff of the House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs
key_responsibilities: examining agency health care activities and composing analytical documents and policy recommendations in an extremely fast-paced environment
requirements: expert knowledge of health care quality and safety, care coordination, integrated health care systems, and health care administration
developed this experience in a clinical setting (specializing in care coordination or health care informatics)
strong analytical skills and management experience
health care-related investigatory background is preferred, but not required

office: Senior member of House Oversight & Government Reform Committee
key_responsibilities: handle the full committee and relevant portfolio of legislative issues
requirements: minimum of 2 years of experience at the Legislative or Senior Legislative Assistant level
track record of drafting bills and amendments

key_responsibilities: managing and maintaining the Member’s daily and long-term calendar both in the district and in D.C.
working with a variety of stakeholders to balance the Member’s time between commitments
ensure the Member is provided with briefing materials for each event and meeting
driving the member to events
performing other duties as required
requirements: Capitol Hill and/or executive assistant experience preferred
A driver’s license is required
PNW ties are a plus
detail-oriented
able to juggle multiple tasks at once
excellent interpersonal skills
problem solver
understand the logistics of travel among various time zones

key_responsibilities: draft legislation
analyze bills
meet with constituents concerning policy matters
requirements: bright, creative, and self-motivated
libertarian or classical liberal in the tradition of F.A. Hayek, Henry Hazlitt, and Frédéric Bastiat
strong commitment to individual liberty, economic freedom, the Rule of Law, and the Constitution
excellent writer and clear thinker willing to take on the most serious impediments to a freer, more prosperous America
BA or equivalent
degree in economics or at least two years of relevant policy experience is preferred
